Data: 12.35pm England have won the toss and will field. England go in with an unchanged team and adopt and unchanged gameplan. Australia too are unchanged and Ponting, flinty-eyed as ever, understandably wants to see more from his batsmen.
Anderson to Watson, no run tidy start from Anderson, zipping an outswinger past off stump and Watson leaves it alone
Anderson to Watson, no run ooh, bit loose from Watson, Anderson got this to jag away off the seam and Watson fenced at it, no harm done though and Kieswetter collects
Anderson to Watson, 1 run Australia are off, in gentle fashion, another outswinger finds the outer half of the bat and runs away for a single backwards of point
Anderson to Paine, 1 wide Anderson searches for an inswinger and duly fires it down leg for a wide
Anderson to Paine, no run better here, adjusting to outside off stump, Paine, who has a face far more gentle than his name, leaves well alone
Anderson to Paine, no run swing again, nice to see some movement in the air, Paine looks carefully and leaves it alone
Anderson to Paine, 1 run Paine is off and running, nudging the ball to mid on and scampering through for a single. Decent first over for both sides you'd think
Bresnan to Paine, FOUR runs well, the delivery is far more gentle than the hair-do, floated up and Paine pushes a straight drive down the ground for four, with minimum of fuss
Bresnan to Paine, no run ah, good response here, quicker, better length, jagging away and Paine plays and misses
Bresnan to Paine, no run good cricket here, full, touch of movement and Paine defends tidily
Bresnan to Paine, 2 runs another ball fractionally overpitched, Paine pushed a drive down the ground via an inside edge, and collects a couple
Bresnan to Paine, no run another good response from Bresnan, this bounced and left Paine and he could only flinch at it outside off stump
Bresnan to Paine, no run tidy finish to the over, fuller, some away movement and Paine lets it go by
Anderson to Watson, no run tidy stuff here again from Anderson, outside off and Watson leaves alone
Anderson to Watson, no run fuller this time, Watson leans into a solid defensive block. He's a serious unit Watson.
Anderson to Watson, no run oh good ball here, some late movement away from the bat, Watson thinks about a cut and is beaten outside off
Anderson to Watson, no run another probing delivery, looks like it will be good Jimmy today, fullish, Watson plays around a defensive block a touch and it squirts to point
Anderson to Watson, no run this time Watson is more crisp and sure, blocking firmly to cover
Anderson to Watson, no run Anderson completes a good over with Watson full-facing it back to the bowler
Bresnan to Paine, no run good delivery this, Paine stretches forward and defends a touch uneasily
Bresnan to Paine, no run Bresnan is lucky to get away with this, it was short and wide but Paine could not time his cut shot at all
Bresnan to Paine, 1 run touch fortunate for Paine this time, skews off an outside edge down to third man for a single
Bresnan to Watson, no run tidy stuff here, Bresnan jumps wide of the crease and angles this into Watson, who defends
Bresnan to Watson, no run the minute the ball is in his half, Watson really winds up for a big crisp drive, he really plays the shot well, but this time straight to a fielder at cover

Bresnan to Watson, 3 runs good shot I guess, Watson didn't time it at all, but with the field up the shot was on, it was a touch short from Bresnan and Watson tried to front-foot pull it, didn't get much of it but it went down to
Anderson to Watson, no run nothing fancy attempted by Watson here, just old-fashioned forward defence
Anderson to Watson, no run once again Watson plays this out the coaching manual, defending into the off side
Anderson to Watson, no run oops, really Watson should have punished this, a touch of width and Watson slashed hard at thin air
Anderson to Watson, no run bit of an appeal here from Anderson as he angled this into the stumps, Watson got an inside edge though, and it was probably going over the top. Not out really.
Anderson to Watson, FOUR runs good response from Watson, top shot this, touch too short and wide from Anderson and Watson murdered it, thumping behind point for four
Anderson to Watson, FOUR runs two in two! Anderson goes full this time so Watson unleashes his big front-foot drive, banging it past Anderson for four more
Bresnan to Paine, no run Paine is always the more sedate of the two openers and here he works Bresnan quietly to square leg
Bresnan to Paine, no run this is a touch ambitious, Paine gives himself room, aiming to carve one over cover, but misses the ball entirely
Bresnan to Paine, no run less expansive here, dropping a fullish delivery into the off side
Bresnan to Paine, no run good ball here, Paine commits early to a forward defence and is forced to play around his pad a fraction
Bresnan to Paine, no run this time it's a more conventional defensive block, good pressure here from Bresnan
Bresnan to Paine, no run very good, the two boundaries that ended the last over were followed by a maiden here from Bresnan, just restricting Australia's run rate
Broad to Watson, no run very accurate start from Broad, just outside off stump on a length and Watson defends

Broad to Watson, FOUR runs well, it's a simple game, go full to Watson and be punished. That's exactly what happened here, it was full, Watson planted his front leg down the pitch and thumped it over cover for four
Broad to Watson, no run very lucky escape here for Broad, he went full and down the leg side, Watson clipped round the corner but picked out the short fine leg
Broad to Watson, 1 run this time it's back to a decent length and Watson blocks and collects a single
Broad to Paine, no run Paine has not really got going yet, and here he blocks off the front foot
Broad to Paine, no run touch of extra bounce, Paine works it to point very carefully. He's got 8 from 20
Bresnan to Watson, no run solid stuff from Bresnan, not much on offer, back of a length, on off stump, Watson blocks
Bresnan to Watson, no run England look intent not to pitch up to Watson, and fair enough, this is back of a length and dabbed into the midwicket region
Bresnan to Watson, no run touch fuller this time, Watson rocks forward and blocks
Bresnan to Watson, FOUR runs poor delivery this, shoved down the leg side and with fine leg up, it's help-yourself time, Watson duly does, wheeling it round the corner for four
Bresnan to Watson, no run much better this time, back of a length on the stumps, Watson can only defend
Bresnan to Watson, 1 run neatly played by Watson to finish the over, opening the face and guiding a cut down to third man for a single
Broad to Watson, no run Watson looking in good touch, defending this very firmly back to the bowler
Broad to Watson, no run action replay here, on a length and line, and defended
Broad to Watson, no run this skids through a fraction outside off stump, Watson aims a cut shot but it's a touch too close for the shot and it ghosts past the edge
Broad to Watson, 1 run nicely done from Watson, dabbing this into the leg side and scampering through for a swift single
Broad to Paine, 1 bye well done the pitch! Oval bounce here, it was a touch short and leapt up, over Paine's cut shot and carried on climbing, eventually bursting through Kieswetter's gloves
Broad to Watson, no run tidy finish to a tidy over, well defended by Watson

Bresnan to Paine, OUT all over for Paine! He's struggled today and it was a tame end. He tried to work it into the leg side, got a leading edge and looped very gently to Morgan at cover. Bresnan has his first wicket in the series
Bresnan to Watson, 1 run Watson very casually guides this down to third man for a single
Bresnan to Ponting, no run good start to the new man, Bresnan goes full and straight, Pointing jumps into a forward block
Bresnan to Ponting, no run good start, Ponting jumps into a forward block
Bresnan to Ponting, no run good line to Ponting, outside off stump, Ponting leaves. I'd rather a slip than the two short men catching, but we shall see
Bresnan to Ponting, FOUR runs poor finish to the over, slipped down the leg side, Ponting clips it for four.
Broad to Watson, no run on off stump, defended back to the bowler
Broad to Watson, no run hits the pitch hard and Watson pushes square into the covers
Broad to Watson, no run a punchy back-foot drive this time, but straight to square cover
Broad to Watson, 1 run loses his line onto leg stump, worked down to fine leg
Broad to Ponting, 1 run ooh, banged in short and Ponting goes for a pull which he splices over the man very close at short midwicket and it lobs wide of mid-on
Broad to Watson, no run nicely timed with a drive off the back foot but straight to the man at cover
Bresnan to Ponting, no run outside off, takes a big stride into the shot and defends to cover
Bresnan to Ponting, no run good line, back of a length on off stump and Ponting defends towards the bowler
Bresnan to Ponting, no run stays on the back foot and opens the face into the off side
Bresnan to Ponting, FOUR runs beautiful timing from Ponting, Bresnan drifts a little too straight and is clipped perfectly between deep square and fine leg
Bresnan to Ponting, FOUR runs glorious...so much for dodgy form as Ponting leans into a drive, on the up, which bisects cover and mid off. It wasn't a bad ball, just top batting
Bresnan to Ponting, 1 wide responds with a bouncer which is too short according to the umpire so he'll have to bowl that again
Bresnan to Ponting, no run targets the pads, was lucky that wasn't dispatched as well with Ponting clipping straight to short midwicket
Broad to Watson, no run back of a length on off stump, Watson defends with an open face to backward point
Broad to Watson, FOUR runs lovely shot as he waits for this one outside off then glides it through the vacant slip cordon and it races away
Broad to Watson, 1 run takes his eyes off a short ball as he pulls rather ungainly through the legside but safe of any fielders
Broad to Ponting, 1 run full outside off stump, met with a big stride as Ponting drives into the covers...beats cover and mid-off cleans up
Broad to Watson, no run drives into the pitch and it bounces back towards Broad
Broad to Watson, SIX runs gee, what a shot that is, as Watson picks a slower ball and dispatches straight down the ground into the sightscreen with a free swing of the arms
Yardy to Ponting, 1 run round the wicket, on leg stump and worked out to deep midwicket
Yardy to Watson, no run outside off, defended softly into the off side
Yardy to Watson, 1 run punched down the ground to long-on
Yardy to Ponting, 1 run pushed off the back foot to long-off
Yardy to Watson, 2 runs whipped nicely off leg stump and beats midwicket with good placement
Yardy to Watson, no run dropped down the leg side, missed by Kieswetter and not called wide...was there an edge? Or was it pad?
Broad to Ponting, no run outside off and left alone, Kieswetter doesn't collect this one cleanly either
Broad to Ponting, no run full on middle stump, nicely driven down the on side but the mid-on is very straight and cuts it off
Broad to Ponting, no run banged in short outside off, must have been close to a wide as Ponting just swayed out of the way
Broad to Ponting, no run defends from off stump with an open face and finds backward point
Broad to Ponting, no run good ball, lifting off a length with some extra pace but Ponting is equal to it and pushes into the off side

Broad to Ponting, FOUR runs spoils a good over, but it's not all Broad's fault...Ponting drives a wide ball over backward point and Bresnan makes a horrid mess of the save at third man as the ball goes through his legs...not goo
Yardy to Watson, no run tossed up a touch more, driven firmly back to Yardy
Yardy to Watson, 1 run pushed straight down the ground
Yardy to Ponting, no run driven nicely into the covers but Collingwood makes a good save
Yardy to Ponting, no run worked off leg stump into the midwicket area and can't beat the fielder
Yardy to Ponting, 1 run nudged into the leg side again, this time just wide of the fielder and although Watson is a little slow he's comfortable enough
Yardy to Watson, 1 run a neat punch to long-on to end the over
Swann to Watson, no run onto the back foot and whipped to short midwicket
Swann to Watson, no run tossed up outside off, Watson leans forward and defends

Swann to Watson, OUT gone! Would you believe it, Watson has picked out deep midwicket with absolute precision as he went for a slog sweep. Eoin Morgan barely had to take step and Watson can barely drag himself away...he's been i
Swann to Clarke, no run turned from off stump to midwicket
Swann to Clarke, 1 run uses his feet and works this from outside down to long-on
Swann to Ponting, no run pushed gently into the leg side
Broad to Clarke, no run back of a length on middle, Clarke easily behind the line and defends
Broad to Clarke, 1 run another short one and pulled away down to fine leg
Broad to Ponting, no run full on off stump, driven firmly to mid-off
Broad to Ponting, 1 run short one to the captain, pulled uppishly towards fine leg but it lands short of the fielder...still, not convincing, and that's how he fell at the Rose Bowl
Broad to Clarke, 1 run good delivery, short of a length on off stump, but well played as Clarke drops it into the off side with soft hands and Ponting is quick to call him through
Broad to Ponting, no run walks across the crease and defends solidly down to mid-off
Swann to Clarke, 1 run steps back and drives out to the deep cover sweeper
Swann to Ponting, no run attacking line outside off, Ponting comes forward and defends square
Swann to Ponting, no run turned from off stump to the man at square leg
Swann to Ponting, 1 run whipped from outside off, midwicket gets a hand on it but can't stop the run as it is parried to long-on
Swann to Clarke, no run worked straight to midwicket this time
Swann to Clarke, no run down the pitch, nice flight from Swann, and Clarke can only clip to square leg
Broad to Ponting, no run on off stump, pushed back to the bowler
Broad to Ponting, no run pitched up on off stump, Ponting drives but without timing this one and picks out mid-off
Broad to Ponting, 1 run banged in short, that came right out of the screws as Ponting pulls but it races straight to deeps square
Broad to Clarke, 1 wide banged in short and it flies down the leg side which makes it an easy call for the umpire
Broad to Clarke, no run back of a length, Clarke hops into line and defends to the off side
Broad to Clarke, no run that's a good bouncer over off stump, Clarke sways out of the line
Broad to Clarke, no run stays short of a length but Clarke is equal to it and defends to mid-on
Swann to Ponting, no run good from Swann, flighting it and holding it back a touch, Ponting carefully defends off the front foot
Swann to Ponting, 1 run nicely played, skipped down the wicket and clipped in front of midwicket for a single
Swann to Clarke, 1 run neatly done from Clarke, milking it down the ground for one
Swann to Ponting, 1 run touch too short this time, allows Ponting to get back and cut behind point for a single
Swann to Clarke, 2 runs dropped by Anderson! you'd expect better from him, Clarke danced down the track and scythed a cover drive straight to Anderson at short cover, but it burst through the hands
Swann to Clarke, 1 run Clarke this time casually works it down the ground for another single
Anderson to Clarke, no run and starts well enough, outside off stump, Clarke's back-foot drive finds no timing and it trickles out to cover
Anderson to Clarke, 2 runs touch wide from Anderson and some very good running allows Clarke to collect two from an outside-edge that goes out to third man
Anderson to Clarke, 2 runs another fielding mishap, this time at point, a cut shot goes through the sliding fielder and allows a couple
Anderson to Clarke, no run Clarke is really throwing his hands at the ball outside off stump, the pitch is very true so he can get away with it, but the timing is not quite there
Anderson to Clarke, no run Anderson gets away with this, shoved full and down the leg side but Clarke misses the leg-side flick
Anderson to Clarke, no run Anderson reverts to a line just outside off, Clarke drives and it goes out to mid off
Swann to Ponting, 1 run nicely played by Ponting, in total control as he walks down the wicket and works it down to long on
Swann to Clarke, 1 run Clarke likes what he saw, so repeats the shot

Swann to Ponting, FOUR runs top stuff from the batsmen, having milked the good balls for singles, this time Ponting punishes the short ball, cutting crisply, well in front of square for four to deep cover
Swann to Ponting, 1 run the boundary is followed up by a gentle work for a single round the corner
Swann to Clarke, 2 runs nicely done from Clarke, working into space in the leg side for a couple
Swann to Clarke, 1 run full and flighted from Swann, and Clarke tickles it into the midwicket region for a single, good over for Australia
Anderson to Clarke, no run looks a very good pitch for batting, coming on to the bat nicely, not much movement, here Clarke's leg-side flick finds mid on
Anderson to Clarke, no run outside off stump here and Clarke is completely disinterested, leaving it well alone
Anderson to Clarke, no run good ball from Anderson, back of a length, outside off stump and Clarke defends to point
Anderson to Clarke, FOUR runs good shot, really good stuff to relieve the pressure, edges down the ground and gives himself a touch of room, carves it over cover to collect four
Anderson to Clarke, 1 wide Anderson's response is short and a touch wide outside off, too wide for the umpire's liking

Anderson to Clarke, FOUR runs wow, really nicely played here, very good timing, Clarke edged down the wicket and leant on the ball to send it skimming through midwicket for four. Very quick outfield here
Anderson to Clarke, 1 run another good over for Australia, Clarke cuts this to deep point to keep the strike
Swann to Clarke, no run flatter from Swann, and a touch quicker, Clarke dabs it to short midwicket
Swann to Clarke, 2 runs fraction short outside off, finds some spin, Clarke is a good player of spin and guides it down to third man
Swann to Clarke, no run nicely bowled here, touch slower and given more air, Clarke came down the wicket but missed his leg-side nurdle
Swann to Clarke, 1 run this time it's quicker and flatter and Clarke pushes it past short midwicket for a single
Swann to Ponting, 1 run Ponting calmly and crisply works this down the ground for a single
Swann to Clarke, no run quicker ball to finish, Clarke tried to dab it behind square on the off side, but got too much of the ball
Yardy to Ponting, no run good start from Yardy and Ponting stretches forward and defends
Yardy to Ponting, 1 run touch more air here, and Ponting pushes it gently down the ground for a single
Yardy to Clarke, 1 run Clarke similarly clips it down the ground for a single, very simple stuff it seems
Yardy to Ponting, 1 run touch shorter and quicker, the cut shot wasn't timed at all and it went one-bounce to Strauss at point. Pointing's 13,000th ODI run. Good god!
Yardy to Clarke, 1 run once again it's pushed gently and comfortably down the ground for a single
Yardy to Ponting, 1 run Ponting completes the over by milking one down the ground
Swann to Ponting, 1 run very good from Swann, flight, a touch of drift, Pointing stretches forward defends, and it comes off the outside edge for a single to point
Swann to Clarke, 1 run Clarke reads the script perfectly and milks a single down the ground for one
Swann to Ponting, 1 run this time it's a touch leg-sided and nibbled for one to square leg
Swann to Clarke, 1 run pushed away for a single past point
Swann to Ponting, no run dot ball this time, Ponting tried to ease a single down the ground but Swann was swiftly across to intercept
Swann to Ponting, FOUR runs top shot, really good to finish the over. Ponting down on one knee and sweeping firmly behind square for a welcome boundary
Yardy to Clarke, no run Clarke trying to find a gap behind point but the angle into him from Yardy is too strong and he can't quite control it as he'd like
Yardy to Clarke, no run touch shorter this time but the cut shot finds short third man
Yardy to Clarke, 1 run this time Clarke gets the single, angling in front of midwicket for one
Yardy to Ponting, 1 run another single here, Ponting pushing very securely down the wicket
Yardy to Clarke, 1 run Clarke skips down the track and carefully works the ball to long on
Yardy to Ponting, 2 runs good finish from Ponting again, this time he's down the track, giving himself a fraction of room and driving through extra cover for a couple
Wright to Clarke, no run bustles in and, as have all the England bowlers today, starts very well, on a length and line, defended back down the pitch
Wright to Clarke, no run similar ball, Clarke is a touch hurried in defence, pushes it back to the bowler

Wright to Clarke, no run top fielding there by the stumps! Clarke crisply struck a perfectly straight drive, but it clattered into the stumps at the non-striker's end. Luckily for Ponting, who was well out his ground, the bowler
Wright to Clarke, 1 run top fielding again, but this time it's by Anderson, another full ball is clattered by Clarke, but Anderson's dive at cover saved the boundary
Wright to Ponting, no run well, full on leg stump, asking for punishment, but the leg-side clip picks out midwicket
Wright to Ponting, 1 run somehow, this over has only gone for two as Ponting drives down the ground. Lucky for England that
Yardy to Ponting, 1 run Yardy will be quite pleased with this, a gentle full toss is bunted down the ground for just a single
Yardy to Clarke, 1 run Clarke this time edges down the wicket and full-faces to long on
Yardy to Ponting, 1 run Ponting stretches forward and dabs a single to cover
Yardy to Clarke, 2 runs good timing here earns Clarke a couple, pushed firmly and perfectly straight
Yardy to Clarke, 1 run similar shot, but this time the timing is a fraction worse so long on scoots round to field
Yardy to Ponting, 1 run touch shorter from Ponting, he gets back and drives to long on for a single
Wright to Ponting, 2 runs driven square through the covers, nicely placed and enough to bring up Ponting's fifty...a steady innings
Wright to Ponting, 1 run tucked off leg stump out to deep square
Wright to Clarke, 1 run driven at the top of the bounce down to long-off
Wright to Ponting, 2 leg byes fired down the leg side, flicks the pad and evades the diving Kieswetter towards fine leg who pulls it up just inside the boundary
Wright to Ponting, 1 run works with the angle coming into him again down to fine leg
Wright to Clarke, no run punched firmly down the pitch, well timed and Wright dives to his right to make a good save in his follow through
Bresnan to Ponting, FOUR runs that's a top shot, hint of width outside off and driven on the up between cover and mid-off...Ponting at his best
Bresnan to Ponting, 1 run goes straighter this time and Ponting drives towards mid-on who is inside the ring
Bresnan to Clarke, 1 run outside off, opens the face down to third man
Bresnan to Ponting, no run slower ball outside off, Ponting holds back on his shot then opens the face and finds backward point
Bresnan to Ponting, no run well bowled, outside off and comes back at Ponting who defends awkwardly into the off side
Bresnan to Ponting, no run good finish to the over, on middle and off, defended back to the bowler
Wright to Clarke, 1 run punched off the back foot down to long-off
Wright to Ponting, no run drives without any time and it skews back to Wright
Wright to Ponting, FOUR runs clears the in field, full on middle and although it wasn't quite timed he lofted it over straight midwicket and this outfield is so quick it was always four
Wright to Ponting, 1 run drives out to deep cover
Wright to Clarke, no run drives down to mid-on but not off the middle and there's no single
Wright to Clarke, 1 run mid-on has dropped back now, so this is an easy single as he punches down the ground
Bresnan to Clarke, FOUR runs banged in short and that was very easy for Clarke to pull it away off the front foot powerfully over midwicket
Bresnan to Clarke, no run good comeback, slower ball on off stump and cramps Clarke for room as he tries to drive
Bresnan to Clarke, no run full outside off, drives again without timing to cover
Bresnan to Clarke, no run step across his crease outside off stump and works straight to midwicket
Bresnan to Clarke, 1 run pushed up to mid-on and they scamper through
Bresnan to Ponting, 1 run worked off the stumps down to long leg
PD Collingwood to Ponting, no run on the stumps, worked back to the bowler
PD Collingwood to Ponting, no run dragged down short, pulled away but he picks out square...that was begging for the boundary
PD Collingwood to Ponting, 1 run comes forward and works down to long-on
PD Collingwood to Clarke, 2 runs worked off the stumps through midwicket and that takes Clarke to his fifty from 61 balls...a compact innings from the vice-captain
PD Collingwood to Clarke, no run uses his feet, pushes down the pitch and Collingwood dives to field, in the process getting tangled around Ponting's legs
PD Collingwood to Clarke, 1 run low full toss on leg stump but it only costs a single out to deep midwicket
Yardy to Clarke, 1 run steps back outside leg to give himself room and cuts hard through cover
Yardy to Ponting, 1 run tossed up and bunted down the ground to long-off
Yardy to Clarke, 2 runs fired in at leg stump, whipped away out to deep square and they sprint hard between the wickets
Yardy to Clarke, 1 run uses his feet and drives inside-out to long-off
Yardy to Ponting, no run over the wicket now, full on leg stump and driven firmly back to Yardy
Yardy to Ponting, FOUR runs reverse sweep from Ponting, well played and well connected as he slots it backward of square through the off side
PD Collingwood to Clarke, 2 runs down the pitch and drives through the covers out to the sweeper
PD Collingwood to Clarke, 1 run low full toss which is driven down the ground
PD Collingwood to Ponting, FOUR runs dragged down short and pulled away over midwicket, one bounce and across the boundary
PD Collingwood to Ponting, 1 wide down the leg side, well taken by Kieswetter
PD Collingwood to Ponting, 1 run flicked in the air wide of midwicket and down to long-on
PD Collingwood to Clarke, 1 run skips down the track again and turns it along the ground through midwicket
PD Collingwood to Ponting, 2 runs opens the face and drives nicely through the covers, placement is excellent and allows them back for a second
Yardy to Clarke, 1 run around the wicket, worked away through midwicket
Yardy to Ponting, 2 runs that's a lovely shot as he comes down the pitch outside leg and drives out extra cover...but the sweeper keeps them to a couple
Yardy to Ponting, no run tries to work into the leg side but goes straight back to Yardy
Yardy to Ponting, 1 run pushed down to long-on

Yardy to Clarke, 1 run well, some good cricket and not-so-good cricket there as Collingwood makes a fine save at cover but couldn't get the throw quite right with Ponting struggling to reach his ground at the striker's end
Yardy to Ponting, no run fielded by the bowler
Anderson to Clarke, 2 runs good ball from Anderson, full and straight, whipped to midwicket where a diving stop keeps it to two
Anderson to Clarke, 1 run short ball here, slower again, Clarke pulls but without much power and picks out deep midwicket

Anderson to White, FOUR runs well, it wasn't quite where bear-man White planned, but he'll take all of it, he aimed an enormous slog, it came off the outside edge, zipping wide of short third man for four
Anderson to White, 1 run this time he connects more fully, without much timing and collects one to mid on
Anderson to Clarke, 1 run Clarke can't find a big shot here, but he does collect one to cover
Anderson to White, 1 run decent finish, but the earlier boundary made it a good over for Australia, here White digs out a yorker to cover and collects a single
Broad to White, no run White backs away, giving himself plenty of room to swing his big arms, but he can't quite time it and it trickles to cover

Broad to White, OUT gone this time! White couldn't quite going and here he tried to smash a short ball out the ground, couldn't get much of it and Anderson took an easy catch on the square leg boundary
Broad to Clarke, no run Clarke backs well away and Broad fires yorker well outside off, Clarke can't reach it, so oddly, it's a leave
Broad to Clarke, 1 run another slower ball bouncer, and once again it's not timed, I'm not sure I've seen any of these slow bouncers timed, Clarke pulls it down to deep square
Broad to Hussey, 1 run Hussey is away immediately, pushing down the ground for a single
Broad to Clarke, 1 run good finish to a good spell from Broad, as Clarke bunts it down the ground for one
PD Collingwood to Clarke, 1 run opens the face into the covers
PD Collingwood to Ponting, 1 run full and driven down to long-on which brings up the 200

PD Collingwood to Clarke, FOUR runs cuts hard at some width, slots it through the covers and it beats a sprawling Bresnan at deep cover...that was always out of reach, but he's not had the best day in the field
PD Collingwood to Clarke, 1 run down the pitch, drives in the air but one bounce to long-off
PD Collingwood to Ponting, 2 runs elegantly flicked over midwicket, a nice flourish from Ponting, and long-on runs around to field
PD Collingwood to Ponting, 2 runs steps back to leg, drives through the covers for another brace
Yardy to Clarke, 1 run round the wicket, outside leg stump and flicked out to deep square
Yardy to Ponting, no run cramped for room and pushed back to the bowler
Yardy to Ponting, 1 run worked in the air but bounces well short of long-on
Yardy to Clarke, no run pushed out to midwicket
Yardy to Clarke, 1 run drives past a diving Yardy down to long-off
Yardy to Ponting, 1 run driven hard along the ground through cover
Anderson to Clarke, no run Clarke again has backed away and Anderson fires it in full outside off, Clarke can't reach it

Anderson to Clarke, OUT well, suicidal running from Hussey. Clarke murdered a drive straight to Strauss at extra cover, Hussey ran for a single which was never these, Strauss calmly threw back to Anderson, who took the bails off
Anderson to Clarke, 1 run good bowling from Anderson, landing those old-fashioned, death-over yorkers and Clarke can only jab it down the ground for one

Anderson to Smith, 1 bye goodness me, if Smith had connected here this ball would still be travelling, slow bouncer, and an enormous swipe is missed, went one-bounce to Kieswetter who fumbled and allowed a bye

Anderson to Clarke, 2 wide oops! This must have just got stuck in Anderson's hands, it was so, so short, almost pitched on the bowler's feet, looped up miles over the batman, with enough time to collect a bye as well
Anderson to Smith, FOUR runs oh dear, poor ball this, short and down the leg side, Smith helped it on its way and collected four
Anderson to Smith, FOUR runs lovely shot to finish, really top shot, it was full and Smith whipped it into the gap in front of midwicket for four. Could be very important runs these last two balls
Bresnan to Clarke, 1 run Clarke gets a single straight away, might just be best for Australia that, mistiming a drive to mid off
Bresnan to Smith, 2 runs full and straight, good bowling, Smith squeezes out a drive and some top running allows him to come back for two
Bresnan to Smith, FOUR runs lovely shot, this innings could be a game-changer, he gets down on one knee and dinks it over the short fine leg for four
Bresnan to Smith, no run ha! well, he almost found the new gap, aiming a kind of switch-hit, but he couldn't connect
Bresnan to Smith, FOUR runs brilliant stuff this from Smith, conventional shot, just chipping a drive over cover and timing it perfectly to collect all four. Poor old Clarke will be stuck on 99
Bresnan to Smith, 1 bye good ball from Bresnan to finish, yorker, Smith aims big and misses, Kieswetter collects and they run a bye to reach 290
Brydon Coverdale has plenty more in his bulletin and, since we have a moment, I should point any Google Chrome users to our fancy Toolbar, so do enjoy that.

Very good finish there for Australia, but overall they'd be a touch disappointed they couldn't push up to 300 after the platform laid by Ricky Ponting. Michael Clarke played superbly and deserved a century, but in a way was a victim of

Right, the players are heading back out. Strauss and Kieswetter stride to the crease to tones of 'Jerusalem', and it'll be Liam Brickhill to kick things off on commentary. Shaun Tait will open the bowling for Australia
Tait to Strauss, 1 wide pace to start, but not much direction as he sprays one very wide of off stump from over the wicket
Tait to Strauss, no run much better, on a length and fired at off stump. Strauss hops back to defend
Tait to Strauss, no run shorter this time, not quite the bouncer but that leapt disconcertingly up at Strauss, who did very well to keep his eye on the ball and play it down
Tait to Strauss, 1 leg bye back of a length and very sharp. Strauss shapes to tuck the ball to leg but can't quite get it away, but Kieswetter calls him through for a quick single straight away
Tait to Kieswetter, 1 wide not quite adjusted to the change of line to the right-hander, as this one squirts down the leg side
Tait to Kieswetter, no run ooh, almost the delivery he got him with in the last game. Very full, and very fast, but Kieswetter punches to mid on with the full face of the bat
Tait to Kieswetter, FOUR runs width, and Kieswetter seizes upon it in fine fashion with a crunching cover drive. Right out the middle, and well-placed too, in the gap and away for four
Tait to Kieswetter, no run a touch of width again, but he pulled the length back and Kieswetter is quite happy to leave
Bollinger to Strauss, no run good start, on a length around off stump and Strauss defends back down the wicket
Bollinger to Strauss, FOUR runs too short, and Strauss is in position in a flash to thump a pull up and over midwicket. He trusts the bounce in the wicket and went through with the shot
Bollinger to Strauss, no run much fuller, and it's cracked to mid on

Bollinger to Strauss, FOUR runs slapped away behind square on the off side! Bollinger is just feeding Strauss's strengths here, giving him width outside off and he's laced away behind point as a result
Bollinger to Strauss, no run just keep it there! On a length, around off and nothing for Strauss to work with

Bollinger to Strauss, no run Strauss shapes to clip to leg but is too early in the shot and gets himself in a bit of a tangle, and the ball heads back down the wicket instead. Bollinger leaps across in his follow-through to cut i
Harris to Kieswetter, no run emotive appeal first ball as he sends one down full and the ball strikes pad then bat as Kieswetter defends. Too close for the umpire to pick though, so not out
Harris to Kieswetter, 1 run on a length, but on the hips and he's clipped to midwicket
Harris to Strauss, no run nice, accurate stuff from Harris as Strauss chops defensively to point
Harris to Strauss, no run fuller, and Strauss is drawn into a drive. Not quite there to be hit, though, and the ball goes softly to mid-off

Harris to Strauss, 1 run good fielding from Ponting saves runs! That was even fuller and again Strauss launched into a drive, timing it much better this time, but the 35-year-old in the covers tumbles athletically to his left to
Harris to Kieswetter, 2 runs too straight, too full, and he's worked away to deep midwicket where Hussey cuts the ball off and hurls in a return
Bollinger to Strauss, no run a touch full on off stump, Strauss drives firmly to mid-off
Bollinger to Strauss, no run beaten outside off! Bollinger bends his back and finds some bounce outside off to beat a slightly airy woft by England's captain
Bollinger to Strauss, 1 run aggressive from Strauss, as he backs to leg and slaps the ball to cover. Just the one run though

Bollinger to Kieswetter, no run good stuff from Bollinger, as Kieswetter pushes at one angled across him and is beaten as well. He pulled the bat inside the line, but only after the ball was already past him
Bollinger to Kieswetter, no run a touch fuller, and Kieswetter presses forward to defend. Probing stuff so far from Bollinger
Bollinger to Kieswetter, no run full again, but pitching outside off and angled across him from over the wicket and Kieswetter raises his bat up and out of the way to leave

Harris to Strauss, no run Strauss is beaten again outside off, but this time the ball was there to be hit. Short and wide, you'd back Strauss to put that away, but it just bounced a fraction more than he was expecting
Harris to Strauss, no run Strauss misses a pull this time! Again, the shot was on, but now he plays over the top of it as the ball scoots over off stump
Harris to Strauss, 1 run full on off stump, Strauss drives strongly down the ground but mid-off runs round in a flash to cut it off cleanly and keep them to one
Harris to Kieswetter, no run watchful start from Kieswetter, who leaves alone outside off once again
Harris to Kieswetter, no run off the inside edge, going between his back leg and the stumps and down to short fine leg. That was too close for comfort...
Harris to Kieswetter, no run tight finish, zoning in on off stump and Kieswetter responds with a solid-looking forward defensive
Tait to Strauss, FOUR runs very fast to start... but short and wide, and Strauss slams a cut over backward point to pick up four!

Tait to Strauss, 2 runs dropped! It was a good ball just outside off, Strauss pushes at it and gets a thick edge which flies to Watto at first slip... but he can't hold on! The ball was really motoring, but he just couldn't wrap
Tait to Strauss, no run punched to cover off the back foot
Tait to Strauss, no run fuller this time, outside off, and driven - but straight to cover
Tait to Strauss, no run wow, this has been a very quick over from Tait - high 90s mph. Strauss is hurried into a prod to cover
Tait to Strauss, no run ah, the change-up to finish, as Tait sends down a slower-ball yorker outside off. I say slower, it was still around 80mph...
Harris to Kieswetter, 1 run tapped to midwicket, and he's immediately called through for a quick single
Harris to Strauss, 1 run on a length just outside off, and Strauss opens the face to send the ball to third man
Harris to Kieswetter, no run Harris has been exemplary so far, hurling the ball down at good pace but finding accuracy too - and Kieswetter defends again

Harris to Kieswetter, 1 run Kieswetter tries to relieve the pressure, shimmying to leg and flashing at the ball, which squirts off the outer half of the bat down to third man. Gully would've snaffled that
Harris to Strauss, no run beaten outside off! Wasn't there for the cut, but he went for a flashing front-foot square drive. A little bit of seam movement and the ball whizzed past the edge

Harris to Strauss, FOUR runs great intent from Strauss, as again he charges down the track to get to the pitch and cracks the ball very hard infront of square on the off side. Four runs! And shades of one Matty Hayden...
Tait to Kieswetter, no run back of a length and quick, but Kieswetter hops into a backfoot defensive and plays the ball down under his eyes
Tait to Kieswetter, no run shortish again, just outside off and Kieswetter pushes defensively to point

Tait to Kieswetter, no run fuller this time, and Kieswetter is simply beaten for pace as he pushes half-forward to drive but the ball is upon him before he's properly into the shot, and trickles into the off side
Tait to Kieswetter, 1 run feisty stuff! That was the bouncer, and was reasonably well-directed - not too short, and Kieswetter is hurried into a hook down to fine leg
Tait to Strauss, no run Strauss shuffles across to the off side and works the ball straight to midwicket
Tait to Strauss, no run full, and very fast indeed. Strauss pushes forward and opens the face to send the ball to backward point
Harris to Kieswetter, no run too straight, Kieswetter glances to leg but can't beat the man at short fine
Harris to Kieswetter, no run back of a length on off stump, and Kieswetter gets up on his toes to ride the bounce and defend to off

Harris to Kieswetter, 2 runs nicely played by Kieswetter, the ball was similar to the one before but this time he just angled the bat face to send the ball to third man's right. Tait runs around, but in the meantime they pick up

Harris to Kieswetter, OUT clatter! Harris sent one down much fuller and Kieswetter went for the drive, leaving an enormous gap between bat and pad. There was a touch of wobble on the ball, and some seam movement in after pitching
Harris to Pietersen, no run on a length, Pietersen moves nicely across and defends back down the track
Harris to Pietersen, no run slightly fuller, punched firmly to mid-off
Bollinger to Strauss, 2 runs a touch straight, and Strauss nudges him away behind square on the leg side.
Bollinger to Strauss, FOUR runs so he sends one down short and wide on the off side, and Strauss cracks a cut right out of the middle of the bat to send the ball racing to the backward point boundary
Bollinger to Strauss, 1 run closer to the stumps, and Strauss opens the face of the blade to guide the ball behind square on the off side
Bollinger to Pietersen, FOUR runs crack! Full, wide, and Pietersen absolutely hammers a drive through the covers. The ball raced to the boundary in a flash!
Bollinger to Pietersen, FOUR runs he pulls the length back a touch, but Pietersen drives on the up straight down the ground, beating a diving Ponting at mid-on! Two in two
Bollinger to Pietersen, no run thumped down the ground again! But that's clattered into the stumps at the non-striker's end, and the crowd let out a collective groan as the ball goes nowhere...
Harris to Strauss, no run on a length, straight and pushed to mid-on

Harris to Strauss, 1 run well, an uncharacteristically ungainly pull from Strauss as Harris sends one down a bit shorter. He found himself in no position to play the shot but just went through with it. That was a bit hoicky...

Harris to Pietersen, OUT Harris strikes again! Pietersen went right across to the offside and aimed an extravagant flick over the leg-side but is struck on the back pad. Huge appeal from Australia, and the umpire agrees! Pieters
Harris to PD Collingwood, 1 run nurdle to leg, and he's off the mark straight away
Harris to Strauss, no run on a length on off stump, tapped defensively to cover
Harris to Strauss, 1 run chopped down just behind square, backward point ran in but they committed to the single and it's safe in the end
Bollinger to Strauss, 2 runs just too straight, and Strauss nudges through midwicket, placing the ball well enough to warrant a second
Bollinger to Strauss, no run back of a length on off, Strauss tries to guide the ball to third man but can't beat the man at gully
Bollinger to Strauss, 1 run little shuffle to off, and worked to midwicket for one
Bollinger to PD Collingwood, no run very full outside off from over the wicket, Collingwood drives but the ball squirts off the toe-end of the bat and trickles to mid-off
Bollinger to PD Collingwood, no run Colly walks right across to the off side this time and unleashes a nurdle to leg, but straight to the fielder
Bollinger to PD Collingwood, no run walks across his stumps once again, and punches firmly to mid-on. More orthordox, less nurdley
Harris to Strauss, 2 runs worked to leg, in front of deep midwicket and so they charge through for the second. He couldn't pick the ball up cleanly anyway, so easy runs in the end
Harris to Strauss, no run clipped straight to the close midwicket this time
Harris to Strauss, no run chopped to gully, Colly was thinking about the cheeky single but Strauss sends him back
Harris to Strauss, 1 run Strauss shuffles down the track and drives firmly past the straightish midwicket, but a deep-ish mid-on sprints round to cut the ball off
Harris to PD Collingwood, no run full, driven very hard on the up but straight to extra cover
Harris to PD Collingwood, no run mightily nurdled to leg, but straight to midwicket so no run
Tait to Strauss, no run goes full to start, and Strauss drives a little leaden-footed to extra cover

Tait to Strauss, OUT edged and gone! Well, that curved away from Strauss very late to take the edge of his bat, and Paine takes a regulation catch behind. Tait strikes, and Australia continue to chip away at England as they chas
Tait to Morgan, no run quick, and Morgan toe-ends to slip, along the ground though
Tait to Morgan, no run slightly wider of off, and Morgan leaves well alone
Tait to Morgan, no run slightly wider still, and again Morgan leaves
Tait to Morgan, no run fuller, and flashed behind square on the off side, but well-stopped by a tumbling backward point
Hopes to PD Collingwood, no run nice start, full on off stump and slanting in to Collingwood, who defends towards point
Hopes to PD Collingwood, 1 run slightly wider, Collingwood runs the ball down to third man
Hopes to Morgan, no run straight, and Morgan defends back down the track
Hopes to Morgan, SIX runs thumped! Morgan is in a confident mood, as Hopes sends one down fuller and he lifts it handsomely way over long-on. Effortless, all balance and timing
Hopes to Morgan, 1 run and he follows that up with a little dink behind square to pick up the single
Hopes to PD Collingwood, 2 runs punched firmly to mid-off, where Bollinger just about cuts it off
Tait to Morgan, no run Morgan is content at the moment to leave Tait's rockets alone outside off stump
Tait to Morgan, no run this is swift stuff from Tait and Morgan hurries into a defensive block
Tait to Morgan, no run no slower-ball bouncers from Tait, just full and very very quick, Morgan eases into a forward defence
Tait to Morgan, no run this was a short one, but there was nothing slow about it, England look like they've decided to see Tait out, and Morgan sways out the way of it
Tait to Morgan, no run this is actually short and wide outside off, I reckon any other bowler and Morgan would have had a dart at it, instead he leaves it alone
Tait to Morgan, no run angles it across Morgan, who eagerly shoulders arms, which means Tait has bowled two maidens in a row now
Hopes to PD Collingwood, 1 run Hopes lands his busy right-arm medium on and around off stump, Collingwood must recognise the bowling as reminiscent of his own, and guides it to third man for one
Hopes to Morgan, no run good ball here, nothing for Morgan to latch on to, so instead it's tapped gently back to the bowler
Hopes to Morgan, 1 run drifting a fraction down the leg side, Morgan tickles it round the corner for one
Hopes to PD Collingwood, 2 runs Collingwood managed to get this away for a couple, good calm stuff from him
Hopes to PD Collingwood, no run this time it's on a line and length and Collingwood pushes it back to the bowler
Hopes to PD Collingwood, no run good finish from Hopes and it's full-faced back to the bowler
Smith to Morgan, 2 runs ooh, close here, Morgan's greeted Smith by dancing down the wicket and flicking airily through midwicket, only just out the reach of a diving Ponting
Smith to Morgan, 1 run this time it's more secure from Morgan, chipping down the crease again and working it for a single in front of square on the leg side
Smith to PD Collingwood, no run good ball from Smith, classic legspinner's stock, pitching around leg, spinning away, Collingwood is forward and blocks
Smith to PD Collingwood, 1 run too short and Collingwood cuts, firmly, but to the deep point fielder
Smith to Morgan, 1 run poor ball, deserved more than it got, was very short and Morgan pulled hard but out to deep midwicket
Smith to PD Collingwood, 2 runs good running from Collingwood earns two as he tickled this round the corner towards backward square leg
Hopes to Morgan, no run good from Hopes, nothing fancy, just busy, back of a length outside off and Morgan blocks
Hopes to Morgan, no run touch fuller, Morgan aims a drive but doesn't time it at all
Hopes to Morgan, 2 runs good running again from these two, Morgan whipped it down to fine leg, where a good sliding stop on the boundary could have kept it to one, but he was back in a flash
Hopes to Morgan, no run nothing here, just dabbed into the cover region
Hopes to Morgan, 1 leg bye once again Morgan looking for the leg-side whip, but can't connect and it thuds off the pads for a single
Hopes to PD Collingwood, 1 run touch slower from Hopes and Collingwood eases it down to long on for a strike-stealing single
Smith to PD Collingwood, FOUR runs Collingwood committed to a sweep very early, but played the shot superbly, picking a gap at fine, fine leg and dabbing it just where he planned for four

Smith to PD Collingwood, OUT great response from Smith and Collingwood has gone! Top stuff from Smith, but Collingwood looks unlucky here, he pushed forward to defend and the ball rapped him on the front pad, looked outside the
Smith to Yardy, 1 run Yardy starts well enough, pushing into the covers for one
Smith to Morgan, FOUR runs well, how about that! Lovely shot from Morgan, stuck his foot outside off stump and flicked it over midwicket for four
Smith to Morgan, no run this time he plays the shot a touch more circumspectly, working it along the ground
Smith to Morgan, 1 run finds the gap this time, picking a single into the leg side to keep the strike
Hopes to Morgan, no run good stuff from Hopes, maintaining a tight line and Morgan defends
Hopes to Morgan, 1 run this time Morgan manages to flick it to midwicket for a single
Hopes to Yardy, no run hopes really marching around busily, which suits his new shaven head, and lands this on middle stump for Yardy to defend
Hopes to Yardy, no run pushed across the left hander, was there for a cut shot, which Yardy plays, but misses
Hopes to Yardy, 1 run Yardy gets another chance to play the shot, and does so, guiding it down the third man for one
Hopes to Morgan, no run Hopes's military-medium is working well here, on off stump and Morgan can't squeeze a cut shot away
Smith to Yardy, FOUR runs nicely played by Yardy, down on one knee and sweeping very crisply backward of square for four to bring up England's hundred
Smith to Yardy, 1 run this time it's worked away into the midwicket region for a single
Smith to Morgan, 1 run Morgan repeats the dose, nudging a single into the leg side
Smith to Yardy, 1 run nicely bowled from Smith, flatter and quicker, Yardy played it very carefully towards mid on for one
Smith to Morgan, 1 run Morgan keeps England ticking with a gentle push in front of the wicket on the leg side for a single
Smith to Yardy, no run nicely bowled, touch of air and thrown up outside off inviting a drive, Yardy obliged and didn't time it
Hopes to Morgan, 2 runs good cricket this, more bustling, accurate medium from Hopes, Morgan flicks it in front of square on the leg side to collect a couple
Hopes to Morgan, no run this time it's a tighter line and Morgan can only defend
Hopes to Morgan, no run Morgan tries to manufacture something here, giving himself some room, but he's hurried on a cut shot and can't time it
Hopes to Morgan, no run cracking stuff from Hopes, giving nothing away, Morgan can only defend
Hopes to Morgan, 2 runs ooh, the pressure almost told there, Morgan sliced an airy drive, but it avoided the fielders and he collected a couple to deep cover
Hopes to Morgan, no run good finish from Hopes, on a length, on a line and Morgan defends
Smith to Yardy, 2 runs Yardy will be pleased with this, picking the gap in front of square on the leg side with a crisp sweep to collect a couple
Smith to Yardy, 1 run touch short from Smith, in less circumspect times Yardy might have had a swipe at that, here he is content to push for a single to mid on
Smith to Morgan, no run nothing for Morgan here as he defends quietly off the front foot
Smith to Morgan, 1 run thrown up well outside off again, Morgan watches it turn and deftly nudges a single
Smith to Yardy, 1 run this time it's spinning down the leg side, Yardy helps it on its way but some swift fielding on the fine leg boundary keeps it to one
Smith to Morgan, 1 run another single, worked behind square on the leg side
Hopes to Morgan, 1 run Australia really rushing through their overs here, Hopes continues and Morgan flips this behind him for one
Hopes to Yardy, 1 run good from Yardy, nothing fancy, just pushing the ball into some space towards mid on for one
Hopes to Morgan, 1 run touch too short, Morgan latched on to a pull shot in a flash, but picked out deep midwicket
Hopes to Yardy, 1 bye nicely bowled from Hopes, a touch slower outside off and Yardy was through his drive too quickly, Paine, standing up to the stumps, couldn't collect cleanly, so they stole a bye
Hopes to Morgan, 1 run fuller here and Morgan bunted it down the ground for a gentle single
Hopes to Yardy, 1 run Hopes round the wicket this time, trying to cramp Yardy for room, it works, in a way, but the mistimed cut trickles for a swift single

Bollinger to Yardy, 1 run almost squeezes through first ball, swinging in a fraction and forcing Yardy to play around his front pad, almost gets through but a touch of wood send it to midwicket for one
Bollinger to Morgan, no run well, if Morgan has a weakness it could be in that area, just hanging outside off stump and Morgan fences at it
Bollinger to Morgan, no run much fuller this time, Morgan more comfortable, working it to mid on
Bollinger to Morgan, no run oh dear, grubber! Pitched on a decent length and burrowed under Morgan's bat through to Paine
Bollinger to Morgan, 1 run Morgan tells himself to 'watch the ball' as Bollinger runs up, sound advice at any level, he watches it all the way on to his bat and flicks to square leg for one
Bollinger to Yardy, no run Yardy is shuffling all over the place, eventually he ends up in an orthodox position, but duly plays and misses
Hopes to Morgan, SIX runs this will help! Morgan planted his front foot down the ground and swung hard across the line, pinging it into the crowds over deep midwicket
Hopes to Morgan, SIX runs and again! Even bigger this time, Morgan cleared his front leg and smashed it over a straight midwicket a long, long way
Hopes to Morgan, no run slower ball this time, and Morgan mistimes a drive down the ground
Hopes to Morgan, 1 run this time he collects one, knocking into space
Hopes to Yardy, 1 run Yardy leans forward and squirts a defensive prod towards point for a single
Hopes to Morgan, 1 run single to finish the over, pushed into space on the off side
Bollinger to Morgan, no run plenty of shouts from the fielders as Yardy backed up a long way, Morgan punched into the covers
Bollinger to Morgan, 1 run neatly done here from Morgan to bring up the 50 stand, pushed to long on for one
Bollinger to Yardy, no run touch shorter from Bollinger, climbs on Yardy and he mistimes an attempted work to leg, trickles out on the off side
Bollinger to Yardy, no run good ball from Bollinger, fuller and straighter, Yardy jabs out a defence
Bollinger to Yardy, no run full, straight ball is met by a full, straight bat, as Yardy pushes this to mid off
Bollinger to Yardy, no run very good over from Bollinger, after the flow of runs in the last over this over was an important one and it only went for one
Harris to Morgan, no run very good take by Paine down the leg side, and Harris is probably lucky to get away with it, looked wide.

Harris to Morgan, OUT the bowling change works and Morgan has gone! That could well be it! Harris has made the difference today, and this was full and outside off stump, inviting the flashing drive, but Morgan could only get a f
Harris to Wright, no run starts with an uncertain forward block and Australia are full of beans
Harris to Wright, no run full and swinging in a touch, Wright tries to flap it away into the leg side but can't get much on it
Harris to Wright, no run outside off stump this time, and Wright leaves it well alone
Harris to Wright, no run wicket maiden from Harris, really top over that. Wright leans into a crisp forward block
Smith to Yardy, no run Yardy greets him with an attempted sweep, which he doesn't connect with
Smith to Yardy, no run another dot ball, this time more carefully played back to the bowler
Smith to Yardy, 2 runs nicely played here, a very careful cover drive, timed for a couple
Smith to Yardy, no run Yardy on the sweep again, and the ball drifts wide of off stump, leaving Yardy unable to connect
Smith to Yardy, 1 run this time he works a single into the leg side
Smith to Wright, 1 run full and Wright tickles it round the corner for a single
Hopes to Wright, 1 run short, wide, and slapped very hard but out to the cover sweeper
Hopes to Yardy, no run driven to the off side, out of the middle of the bat but straight to extra cover

Hopes to Yardy, no run Yardy drops the ball at his feet and wanders down, thinking about the single, but Hopes sprints forward and flicks the ball back at the stumps to send him scampering back to the crease. A direct hit would
Hopes to Yardy, no run straightish, Yardy tries to work the ball to midwicket but it thumps into the top of the pad
Hopes to Yardy, 1 run chopped down behind square on the off side for a single
Hopes to Wright, no run quite wide, but no damage - tapped softly to point off the front foot
Smith to Yardy, FOUR runs floated up well wide of off stump and Yardy slams a drive through the covers, hitting it well enough to beat the boundary sweeper
Smith to Yardy, 1 run paddle-swept quite fine, but just the single as the man runs round
Smith to Wright, no run flighted on middle and off, and Wright defends

Smith to Wright, OUT bowled round his legs! Smith has been getting really nice drift, and this has just curved slightly down the leg side and then spun back across to strike the middle and leg stumps. Wright tried to clip to leg
Smith to Bresnan, no run Bresnan looks to get off the mark with a nudge behind square on the off side, but straight to the fielder
Smith to Bresnan, 1 run flicked through square leg, and he will get off the mark this time
Hopes to Bresnan, 1 run punched out to deep cover
Hopes to Yardy, no run curves one in to strike the pad, big appeal but not given. May have struck him just outside the line
Hopes to Yardy, 1 run chance for a run-out! It was dropped into the covers and they just set off, Ponting swooped in a flash and threw with Bresnan well short, but couldn't hit the stumps
Hopes to Bresnan, FOUR runs slices a cut away behind square, third man runs round but can't cut it off and that's four! Bresnan still believes...
Hopes to Bresnan, no run better ball, full on off stump and Bresnan defends
Smith to Yardy, 2 runs full and wide, flashed away square but it's cut off by the sweeper, running to his right
Smith to Yardy, 1 run pushed down to long-on for an easy single
Smith to Bresnan, 2 runs well-placed from Bresnan, who just hangs back in the crease and forces the ball away behind point. Some energetic running gets him two
Smith to Bresnan, 1 run pushed into the covers off the back foot
Smith to Yardy, 1 wide pushed too wide this time, and the drift took it even further
Smith to Yardy, 1 run closer to the stumps this time, and Yardy picks up a single with a firm push through the covers
Smith to Bresnan, 1 run driven down to long-off
Hopes to Bresnan, 1 run sent out to the cover sweeper with a meaty thump
Hopes to Yardy, 1 run pushed down to long-on for an ambled single
Hopes to Bresnan, 1 run short and pulled away square, not quite out of the middle though and so it's easily cut off
Hopes to Yardy, no run squirts off the inside edge and lands at Yardy's feet, Hopes charges across to stop any thoughts of a cheeky single
Hopes to Bresnan, 1 run off the inside edge of Bresnan's bat now, but this time it rolls down to fine leg
Tait to Bresnan, 3 runs starts with a short ball, which Bresnan pulls - not altogether convincingly - to deep midwicket, where a superb effort from Smith keeps the ball from crossing the boundary
Tait to Yardy, 1 run
Tait to Bresnan, no run banged in and the extra effort means he overstepped
Tait to Bresnan, 1 run
Tait to Yardy, no run
Tait to Yardy, FOUR runs down the leg side and glanced away past the keeper
Smith to Bresnan, no run comes forward and pushes into the off side
Smith to Bresnan, 1 run touch short and clubbed towards mid on who makes a diving stop
Smith to Yardy, no run outside off and driven firmly to cover
Smith to Yardy, 1 run width again and another drive to cover, but this time Clarke can't stop it and long-off has to tidy up
Smith to Bresnan, 1 run on off stump, pushed out to the cover sweeper
Smith to Yardy, 1 run tighter to off stump and Yardy eases it down the ground to keep the strike
Tait to Yardy, no run back of a length on off stump, opens the face to backward point
Tait to Yardy, no run beaten outside off by a very full delivery as he tries to run it to third man
Tait to Yardy, 1 run defended into the crease by his feet and he's called through by an alert Bresnan
Tait to Bresnan, no run full and homing in on off stump, Bresnan drives firmly up to mid-off
Tait to Bresnan, no run banged in very short outside off stump and the umpire lets him get away with it
Tait to Bresnan, no run back on a length at off stump, defended to cover to end a tight over
Smith to Yardy, no run Yardy opens the face on the blade and tries to run it down, but finds backward point
Smith to Yardy, 1 run top-edged sweep, but over the 'keepers head and down fine
Smith to Bresnan, 1 run quicker and very full - a yorker - and Bresnan jams the bat down to send the ball into the covers
Smith to Yardy, 1 run driven firmly down to long-off
Smith to Bresnan, 1 run quick, but too short and Bresnan stays deep in the crease and muscles the ball out to deep cover
Smith to Yardy, 1 run swept right out the middle, but along the ground and straight to the man at deep square leg
Bollinger to Yardy, FOUR runs short on off stump, Yardy backs away to leg and cuts out to deep point for four!
Bollinger to Yardy, no run ooh, he stands at the crease this time and Bollinger keeps his line, this time beating the edge as Yardy tries to nudge to third man
Bollinger to Yardy, 1 run backs away again, Bollinger goes full this time and Yardy slices the ball down to third man
Bollinger to Bresnan, 1 run Bollinger comes round the wicket to Bresnan, who chops down to third man to rotate the strike
Bollinger to Yardy, 1 run hacked out to deep midwicket, they briefly consider a second but that would have been foolhardly
Bollinger to Bresnan, no run back of a length on off, Bresnan aims to swipe over cover but misses completely

Harris to Yardy, 1 run fifty for Michael Yardy, and he's played rather well, his first significant effort with the bat for England since his comeback, but it'd take a lot more to give England a chance

Harris to Bresnan, OUT Harris strikes again, what a game he's having! Bresnan attempted to clear the one man at deep long on, curious shot-selection really, and he ended up skiing it straight to Watson on the boundary
Harris to Yardy, FOUR runs Yardy keeps swinging, and this only just passes mid on, once it beats the infield though, it skips along the quick outfield for four
Harris to Yardy, 1 run follows up the boundary with by squeezing a full ball behind point for a single
Harris to Swann, 1 run touch shorter here from Harris, Swann nudges it off his hip for a single to midwicket
Harris to Yardy, 1 run Yardy backs away and aims a gentle drive and gets a single to mid off
Bollinger to Yardy, 1 run full and angled in from round the wicket, Yardy is backing away again and squeezes it out to point for a single
Bollinger to Swann, OUT and another one goes! Bollinger is too sharp for Swann! Bounced up into the rib area, Swann tried to fend it away and could only glove it behind to Paine
Bollinger to Broad, 1 leg bye almost goes first ball as Bollinger, who is really racing in, arrows a yorker into Broad's pads, it was slipping down leg, however, and thudded off the pads for one
Bollinger to Anderson, no run Anderson doesn't see much of his first delivery, zipping past his hanging bat and going through to Paine
Bollinger to Anderson, no run Bollinger lands a yorker which Anderson manages to dig out
Harris to Broad, no run Harris has really bustled in, full of pace and effort, and this hurries Broad into an uncomfortable defence
Harris to Broad, FOUR runs touch shorter here, Broad swats, a touch aimlessly, and gets a top-edge that sails over the keeper for four
Harris to Broad, no run clears his front leg, and aims a big heave outside off stump, but misses
Right, that's just about it from us today. Thanks for all the emails, and I hope you'll join us on Saturday for the final game from Lord's.
Ryan Harris is named man of the match and says he's happy to perform well today after disappointing at Old Trafford.

Important win for Australia, with Tait in the side their bowling has a touch more devil and it has made a real difference. It was a return to the old Australia really, powerful and professional. For their part, England looked a touch f

No whitewash for England, they never got close today. Ponting and Clarke finally gave the Australian bowlers something to work with, and England, chasing a daunting total, could never get going as Harris ran through the top order.
Australia won by 78 runs
Player of the match is Ryan Harris, AUS
